@EmmaBostian @nikazawila It's not illegal, however, if poorly phrased it can open up the basis for a lawsuit. So companies use generic rejection letters to avoid that.
I am a bit jealous about the size of the @GamersNexus mug, compared to the @NordicTweets one. https://t.co/uGGixMBSN7

@NightWhistler @nikazawila @EmmaBostian There are no rules in that sense. The basis for lawsuits are typically laws regarding likestilling/Gleichstellung/anti-discrimination.  In Germany that's the Allgemeines
Gleichbehandlungsgesetz (AGG), and employers want to avoid any wording that could be seen as discriminatory.

@maaretp Ha, I have another "here is what works for ME" talk this year, and it's great to hear that this is valued.

Yes, and? There is no rule that the number of engineers should match the number of microservices. Cut your application in a way that supports your goals and allows you to easily modify, and update it without affecting other services. In #serverless, one function can be a MS, btw. https://t.co/p1cYrQU2re
@paulswail I don't see these as big issues, and I don't think they outweigh the benefits of separating stacks as early possible.

@w3ltraumpirat @michelle_avomo @emilybache @mgaertne @lisihocke @malk_zameth @DorraBartaguiz @tpierrain @maaretp @NicoleRauch @SamirTalwar @sebrose Yes, sorry! https://t.co/drOg0vqYi4
@lucianadrian Yeah, I know it, but it has only one resolution. And squares are getting distorted, which is optically not as pleasant.
@Niklas_L The guaranteed bandwidth depends on the monthly fee. 2 TB traffic is included. And it's actually deployed in large cities like Trondheim. https://t.co/qpAQl1TXfo
@Niklas_L No, especially in the inner cities and older parts there is only phone copper, and sometimes TV coax. So using 5G the effort to lay FTTH can be avoided.

Gratulerer med dagen #Norge üá≥üá¥,
verdens vakreste land! #17mai https://t.co/wq5TqT5gID
@Niklas_L ?

@DorraBartaguiz @michelle_avomo @emilybache @mgaertne @lisihocke @malk_zameth @tpierrain @maaretp @NicoleRauch @SamirTalwar Yes, can't wait! I'll recommended my junior colleagues to attend the foundation day!
@pati_gallardo Since when do you follow the rules?

@Niklas_L No, there are also old cities here and while digitalisation is far progressed here, there wasn't a strong need for FTTH. Very few worked from home before the pandemic. Trondheim started to lay fiber city wide in 2010 and later and then mostly outside of the inner city,
@Niklas_L where connectivity was poorer and installation easier (often no paved roads).
@Niklas_L Speaking of Fiber. This is fiber getting laid pretty far off the next settlement. Norway is sparsely populated in many regions, so it's hard to reach everyone. https://t.co/fNTutX876Z
This event is on Oslo, but will be recorded: https://t.co/OWE40AG31Z

@EvaNanyonga @maaretp I think the beauty of Gherkin is that it's fully independent to any programming language, which allows you to use it in any of your projects regardless of the implementation language. And it would hide away the page object in your example makes it less noisy.

@maaretp @EvaNanyonga Yeah, I still use it in my projects because it allows ME to quickly scetch a feature TDD style, and then implement it, while I have the outline of what should happend, but don't need to write too many unit tests.

@Der_Pesse @SoCraTes_Conf "this provides a much higher influx of participants which haven‚Äôt attended any conference before that focuses on software as a craft."
is what I wrote about that in https://t.co/g65hwTfclN
